sen.j: 身毛広（むげつのひろ、生没年不詳）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: MUTSUGE no Hiro (date of birth and death unknown) was a man who lived in the Aska Period.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）側について活躍した。
sen.e: He fought with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) and took an active part in the Jinshin War.

sen.j: 身毛氏は牟義都国造の系譜をひき、美濃国の武芸郡（むげのこおり、後の武儀郡）にあった地方豪族である。
sen.e: MUTSUGE was of a Mutsugenokuni no miyatsuko descent (the heads of local governments in ancient Japan) and a powerful local clan in Muge District (later became Mugi District), Mino Province.

sen.j: 壬申の乱で大海人皇子が挙兵を決断したとき、広は吉野にいた皇子のそばにいた。
sen.e: When Prince Oama made the decision to raise an army, Hiro was in Yoshino with him.

sen.j: 皇子自身か行動をおこす2日前、6月22日に、身毛広は村国男依、和珥部君手と3人で美濃国に先行するよう命じられた。
sen.e: On June 22, two days before prince took any action, he sent MUTSUGE no Hiro, MURAKUNI no Oyori, and WANIBE no Kimite to Mino Province.

sen.e: Their task was to convince Yunounagashi, O no Honji who was in Ahamachi District (now known as Anpachi District) at that time to raise his army first.

sen.j: その後の広の活躍は不明だが、乱の後、80戸の封を与えられた（『続日本紀』大宝元年 (701年) 7月21日条）。
sen.e: Although it is unknown what happened to him afterward, it is said that he was given the property with 80 households after the war on July 21, 701 ("Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued)).

sen.j: 『日本書紀』は12月4日に勲功ある人を選んで冠位を増し、小山位以上をあたえたと記してあるので、広もこれと同じかそれ以上の位を受けたと思われる。
sen.e: It is stated in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) that those with distinctive merits were selected on December 4 and given the title Shosen or higher, and therefore Hiro probably received the same or higher title as well.
